title-group.article-title: LINEAR RELATIONS OF ZEROES OF THE ZETA-FUNCTION

abstract.p: This article considers linear relations between the nontrivial zeroes of the Riemann zeta-function. The main application is an alternative disproof of Mertens' conjecture by showing that lim supx→∞ M(x)x–1/2 ≥ 1.6383, and lim infx→∞ M(x)x–1/2 ≤ –1.6383.
